title: Identify What We Are Looking For
text: We are looking for the amount of calories in a hot dog. We also do not know how much calories is in a cup of cottage cheese.
speech: We are looking for the amount of calories in a hot dog. We also do not know how much calories is in a cup of cottage cheese.
pacedSpeech: We are looking for the amount of calories in a hot dog. We also do not know how much calories is in a cup of cottage cheese.

title: Name What We Are Looking For
text: Choose a variable to represent that quantity. Let $$h=the$$ amount of calories in hot dog. Let $$c=the$$ amount of calories in cottage cheese.
speech: Choose a variable to represent that quantity. Let  h is equal to, t h e,  amount of calories in hot dog. Let  c is equal to, t h e  amount of calories in cottage cheese.

title: Translate into a System of Equations
text: The total number of calories in $$2$$ hot dogs and $$3$$ cups of cottage cheese is $$960$$ calories: $$2h+3c=960$$.
speech: The total number of calories in  2  hot dogs and  3  cups of cottage cheese is  960  calories:  2 h plus 3 c is equal to 960 .
pacedSpeech: The total number of calories in   2
hot dogs and   3
cups of cottage cheese is   960

title: Translate into a System of Equations
text: The total number of calories in $$5$$ hot dogs and $$2$$ cups of cottage cheese is $$1190$$ calories: $$5h+2c=1190$$.
speech: The total number of calories in  5  hot dogs and  2  cups of cottage cheese is  1190  calories:  5 h plus 2 c is equal to 1190 .
pacedSpeech: The total number of calories in   5
hot dogs and   2
cups of cottage cheese is   1190
calories:   5 h plus 2 c is equal to 1190

title: Solve the System of Equations
text: To solve the system of equations, use elimination. The equations are in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of c, multiply the first equation by $$-2$$ and the second equation by $$3$$.\n(2*h+3*c=960)*-2\n(5*h+2*c=1190)*3
speech: To solve the system of equations, use elimination. The equations are in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of c, multiply the first equation by  minus 2  and the second equation by  3 .\n(2*h+3*c=960)*-2\n(5*h+2*c=1190)*3

and the second equation by   3

title: Eliminate a Variable
speech: Add the two equations.\n minus 4 h minus 6 c is equal to negative 1920 \n 15 h plus 6 c is equal to 3570

title: Solve for $$h$$
text: c will be eliminated and then solve for $$h$$.\n$$11h=1650$$\n$$h=150$$
speech: c will be eliminated and then solve for  h .\n 11 h, is equal to 1650 \n h, is equal to 150

title: Substitute and Solve for c
text: There are $$150$$ calories in a hotdog.
speech: There are  150  calories in a hotdog.
